ausflora 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Calculate state-level diversity for native, introduced, and more complicated species origins

    state_diversity_counts.Rd

    This function calculates state-level diversity for native, introduced, and more complicated species origins based on the geographic data available in the current Australian Plant Census.

    state_diversity_counts(
  state = c("NSW", "NT", "Qld", "WA", "ChI", "NSW", "SA", "Vic", "Tas", "ACT", "NI",
    "LHI", "MI", "HI", "MDI", "CoI", "CSI", "AR", "CaI"),
  type_of_data = c("stable", "current"),
  ver = "0.0.1.9000"
)

    Arguments

    state

    A character string indicating the Australian state or territory to calculate the diversity for. Default is "NSW". Possible values are "NSW", "NT", "Qld", "WA", "ChI", "SA", "Vic", "Tas", "ACT", "NI", "LHI", "MI", "HI", "MDI", "CoI", "CSI", and "AR".

    type_of_data

    A character string indicating the type of data to use for the calculation. Default is "stable". Possible values are "stable" and "current".

    ver

    A character string indicating the version of the data to use for the calculation. Default is "0.0.1.9000".

    Value

    A tibble of diversity counts for the specified state or territory, including native, introduced, and more complicated species origins. The tibble has three columns: "origin" indicating the origin of the species, "state" indicating the Australian state or territory, and "num_species" indicating the number of species for that origin and state.

    Examples

    state_diversity_counts(state = "NSW", type_of_data = "current", ver = "0.0.1.9000")
#> Rows: 109624 Columns: 37
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr  (31): taxonID, nameType, acceptedNameUsageID, acceptedNameUsage, nomenc...
